bill_title: provide for the establishment and maintenance of a state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the establishment and maintenance of a state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks shall, before July 1, 2017, establish a state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park east of the Missouri River on land that is owned or acquired by the state. The Governor, pursuant to § 5-24-12, may accept, on behalf of the State of South Dakota, the transfer of land for purposes of establishing the facility. The department may accept suitable property from the United States government, any political subdivision of the state, private sources, and any other source desiring to transfer land for such a facility. The department may apply to any agency of the United States government for federal financial assistance or other assistance for the purpose of establishing, developing, operating, or maintaining the park facility. Section 2. The Department of Game, Fish and Parks may enter into agreements for the development, construction, administration, operation, or maintenance of the facility authorized in section 1 of this Act with qualified persons, political subdivisions, federal or state agencies, or business entities. The department, in cooperation with the Department of Veterans Affairs, shall operate, maintain, supervise, and control the facility established under this section. Any portion of the property acquired for the facility that is not yet used or needed for cemetery purposes shall be maintained as a game refuge subject to the provisions of chapter 41-5. Section 3. Any person who is eligible for burial in a national veterans cemetery is eligible for burial in the state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park if the person meets residency requirements promulgated in rules by the Department of Veterans Affairs pursuant to chapter 1-26. Any person who is a retired state employee or was employed as a state employee for at least five consecutive years immediately preceding the employee's time of death, and any state legislator or other elected state official is eligible for burial in the state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park. Any person, or survivor of a person, eligible for interment in the state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park may apply for a burial plot for the eligible person by submitting a request to the Department of Veterans Affairs on a form supplied by the department. The department shall allot plots on a first-come, first-served basis. Section 4. The Department of Veterans Affairs shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish criteria and standards for burial in the state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park established pursuant to this Act. Costs of interment shall be borne by the family or next of kin of the person being interred. The rules may provide for the burial of indigent persons at state expense. The rules shall include requirements for proof of residency, requirements and procedures governing burial in the facility, applications for burial, cost of burial if any, and standards for the cemetery, including standards for decorations, headstones, and other aesthetic, administrative, and operational requirements for the facility. Section 5. There is hereby created the state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park operation fund. Money in the fund shall be used for the development, construction, operation, administration, maintenance, and improvement of the state veterans and public servants cemetery and memorial park. Any money in the fund available for investment shall be invested by the state investment officer and deposited in the fund. The fund consists of appropriations, gifts, bequests, donations, grants, or contributions from private or public sources, including federal grant funds, funding from political subdivisions of the state, federal plot allowance payments, receipts for burial fees, other cemetery receipts, and funds from any other legal source. Any money in the fund shall be budgeted and expended in accordance with chapters 4-7, 4-8, 4-8A, and 4-8B.
